question: Find the equivalent capacitor C as shown in <image 1>, where $\mu F$ denotes a microfarad, equivalent to $10^{-6}$ farad.
description:
The image shows an electrical circuit diagram labeled "Fig. 1." The circuit consists of resistors and capacitors connected in various configurations. 

On the left side of the diagram, there are three resistors with values of 2Ω, 4Ω, and 6Ω. These resistors are connected in a combination of series and parallel arrangements. Specifically, the 2Ω and 6Ω resistors are connected in series, and this series combination is then connected in parallel with the 4Ω resistor.

To the right of the resistors, there are three capacitors with values of 5μF, 2μF, and 4μF. These capacitors are also connected in a combination of series and parallel arrangements. The 2μF and 4μF capacitors are connected in parallel, and this parallel combination is then connected in series with the 5μF capacitor.

The entire circuit is simplified on the right side of the diagram to show an equivalent resistance \( R \) and an equivalent capacitance \( C \). The goal is to find the value of the equivalent capacitance \( C \).

To solve for \( C \), you need to calculate the equivalent capacitance of the three capacitors (5μF, 2μF, and 4μF) using the rules for combining capacitors in series and parallel. The resistors are not relevant to finding the equivalent capacitance \( C \).
